results.title: Jessye Norman: Singer
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain, BBC-TV, Harvey Kass and Cathy Palmer
results.brief_description: The full range and diversity of Jessye Norman’s singing is captured on film at performances in London, Paris and New York. Examples of these performances shown are the role of Ariadne in Strauss’ Ariadne auf Naxos, and the lament from Purcell’s Dido and Aeneas. Jessye also comments on her cultural roots and evolution as a singer.

results.title: Jessye Norman Sings Carmen
results.creator_credit: Antenne-2, BBC, La Sept, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, Philips Classics, Radio France, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Susan Froemke and Peter Gelb
results.brief_description: Featuring highlights from the Philips Classics/Radio France recording of Bizet’s “Carmen”, with Jessye Norman (Carmen), Neil Shicoff (Don Jose), Simon Estes (Escamillo), Radio Chorus France, and National Orchestra of France. Filmed by Albert Maysles and Martin Schaer.

results.title: Jessie Thandi in India; Ellen Youie in China = India; China
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Stephen Cross, Fitzwater Productions, Argosy Films and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series” Through Australian Eyes”. In the first program Australian-born Jessie Thandi journeys to the Punjab region of India, her father’s place of birth in a search for her own identity. In the second program Ellen Youie visits the small Cantonese village where her mother was born, and strengthens the ties she feels with her Chinese heritage.

results.title: Jerusalem: within these walls
results.creator_credit: Miriam Birch, National Geographic Society and WQED
results.brief_description: Narrated by Christopher Plummer, this program offers a kaleidoscopic view and history of the city which is an important centre for three of the world’s great religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam. The old city is divided into four quartes - Christian, Muslim, Jewish and Armenian, where about 26,000 people live. The video profiles residents of old Jerusalem including a Jewish family of Yemeni jewellers; a Belgian refugee from Nazism; a Muslim artisan and television performer, Halil; Father Timothy, private secretary to the Greek Orthodox patriarch and finally, an Armenian Christian, survivor of Turkish oppression, who now works as a photographer.

results.title: Jerusalem: the Holy City
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, F Keller and E Keller
results.brief_description: Concentrating on the historic settings and contemporary shrines of the respective religions, this film develops the theme of Jerusalem as a city sacred to the Jewish, Christian and Islamic faiths. Settings and structures rich in historic association are shown.

results.title: Jenny is a good thing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare and Joan Horvath
results.brief_description: Documentary on the food and nutrition-related activities which are part of the Head Start program for disadvantaged children in the United States. Children are shown learning about food and its preparation by actively involving themselves in tasks to do with food. Narrated by Burt Lancaster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare and Joan Horvath

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Patricia Phillips and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Part of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults on teenage alienation, Jenny is the story of a seemingly tough seventeen-year-old who is arrested for trafficking drugs. Jenny’s story emerges as she is interviewed by a skilful social worker. Her unemployed, alcoholic father has been sexually abusing her, and is now turning his attention to her weaker, younger sister as well.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
A film focusing on a teenage girl in a homosexual relationship. Jenny discusses her perception of the ‘gay’ scene, her relationship and how she feels other people perceive her life-style.

results.title: Jenny
results.brief_description:
Jenny, the manager of a nightclub of dubious reputation, gets involved with Lucien, a member of a gang of criminals. Benoit, the crooked owner of the club, employs a hunchback accomplice to help put an end to their affair. Meanwhile, Jenny’s daughter falls in love with Lucien and becomes her mother’s rival. ‘Jenny’ is Marcel Carne’s first film as director and the first of seven collaborations with screenwriter Jacques Prevert. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Marcel Carne ; writers, Jacques Prevert, Pierre Rocher, Jacques Constant ; photography, Jean Stelli ; music, Joseph Kosma, Lionel Cazaux ; art direction, Jean d’Eaubonne.
Cast: Francoise Rosay, Albert Prejean, Charles Vanel, Lisette Lanvin, Jean-Louis Barrault, Robert Le Vigan, Roland Toutain, Sylvia Bataille, Margo Lion, Rene Genin.

results.title: Jennifer is a lady (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a language-development program for two children with a diagnosis of infantile autism. Emphasises methods and techniques used by teachers to foster receptive and expressive language.
